product_description.product_definition: Portland cement is defined as a hydraulic cement produced by pulverizing clinker, consisting essentially of crystalline hydraulic calcium silicates, and usually containing one or more of the following: water, calcium sulfate, up to 5% limestone, and processing additions.
product_description.facility_name: Holcim Whitehall Cement Plant, 5160 Main Street, Whitehall, PA 18052

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: All input/output data required were collected and included in the LCI modelling. No substances with hazardous and toxic properties that pose a concern for human health and/or the environment were identified.
lca_information.data_collection: Gate-to-gate input/output flow data were collected for limestone quarry, clinker production, and cement manufacture at Whitehall, PA for the reference year 2019.
lca_information.allocation_rules: Recycling and recycled content are modeled using the cut-off rule. Environmental impacts allocated to recovered materials are limited to the treatment and transportation required to use as a cement material input.

data_quality_requirements.completeness: All relevant, specific processes were considered and modeled.
data_quality_requirements.consistency: High level of consistency maintained through mass and energy balances.
data_quality_requirements.reproducibility: Internal reproducibility is possible; external reproducibility is not possible as the background report is confidential.

additional_info.environmental_protection_and_equipment: Holcim manufacturing facilities comply with the U.S. EPA regulations, monitor and report emissions to air during the manufacturing process.
